page.title: 01DORNIE VILLAGE
page.content: In the north west highlands of Scotland on the Inverness to Kyle of Lochalsh road lies the village of Dornie.It sits on the eastern shore at the mouth of Loch Long where that loch joins Loch Duich.It comprises a ribbon development of houses along the edge of the water and before the opening of the road bridge was the ferry terminal to the Lochalsh peninsula.It was also the point from where the ferry crossed to the southern shore of Loch Duich at Totaig.Many of the houses have been taken over as holiday homes but there is still a healthy local population.The main tourist attraction is Eilean Donan Castle which following destruction by the English in 1719 was restored in 1932.Dornie is one of the main centres of Roman Catholicism in the highlands.
